letters.description: Creating a secure therapeutic container and grounding the nervous system to ensure the client feels regulated enough to explore internal states.
Developing interoceptive awareness by identifying and tracking specific physical felt-senses and where they reside in the body.
Linking somatic responses and physiological sensations to underlying emotions, memories, or cognitive belief systems.
Identifying habitual holding patterns, muscular bracing, and chronic tension that signal the body's stored trauma or defense mechanisms.
Facilitating the release of stored autonomic energy through controlled movement, breathwork, or biological completion of the stress response.
Anchoring the new state of ease into the nervous system through rest, neuro-repatterning, and conscious embodiment of the shift.
